page.title: 14Changes in the Area
page.content: Mr Ashton has lived in the area all his life. He is now a parent of two boys who attend the Primary School. He himself attended the school which now houses Lamb's Garage Showroom. He has seen the residential development of the village for which he is grateful, for he believes that the arrival of new people and their ideas into the area is good for the village as a whole. Mr Ashton can remember how during and immediately after the Second World War the fields were put under the plough so that more food could be grown during those times of shortage. Now the land is used for grazing and some has been lost to housing. Mr Ashton believes that the school curriculum is much more exciting now than it was in his day. There are more resources and facilities available. He thinks "Domesday Project" is terrific!
